messages.subject: RE: [Unschooling-dotcom] More computer ideas
messages.msgSnippet: What s ds & dd???  Also apology if I should have sent that cleaning out email directly to april. Sara J. ds = dear son dd = dear daughter dh = dear husband mil
messages.messageBody:
What's ds & dd??? Also apology if I should have sent that cleaning out
email directly to april.

Sara J.


ds = dear son
dd = dear daughter
dh = dear husband
mil = mother in law
fil = father in law

**Or...the first "d" could stand for other things...depending on your mood.

--valerie

The Magic School bus ones are good too. -Amalia-




We have this set & the kids love them, they can get lost for hours if I
don't watch them. DS 4 & 2 will do what they can & then they're willing to
let dd help them.

messages.subject: Re: More computer ideas
messages.msgSnippet: I m coming in a little late on this, but my son is currently enjoying Gizmos & Gadgets , The Incredible Machine , and Pinball Science . I like the DK
messages.messageBody:
I'm coming in a little late on this, but my son is currently
enjoying "Gizmos & Gadgets", "The Incredible Machine", and "Pinball
Science". I like the DK program "I Love Science".

Olivia

messages.subject: More computer ideas
messages.msgSnippet: My son really likes software titles with themes more than the Reader Rabbit types. Microsoft put out an Exploration Series for example that includes World
messages.messageBody:
My son really likes software titles with themes more than the Reader Rabbit
types. Microsoft put out an "Exploration Series" for example that includes
"World of Flight", "Oceans", "Dangerous Creatures", "Dinosaurs", and
"Musical Instruments" among others. They're out of print, but you can
usually pick them up on Ebay for around $5 or so.

Blue Skies!
-Robin-
Mom to Mackenzie (8/28/96) "I have magic in my mind"
and Asa (10/5/99) who doesn't want to take her fairy wings off...ever
http://www.geocities.com/the_clevengers Flying Clevenger Family
